intro: Discophora montana, commonly known as the mountain discophora, is a flowering plant native to high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
